# BIRD-INTERACT 1.0

Content: ## ğŸ“° News - [2025-08-26] ğŸš€ We're excited to announce the release of the **[BIRD-Interact-Full (600)](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-full)** set! It's a tough one â€” the best LLMs are only achieving a **16.33%** success rate, with just **10.0%** on the `c-interact` and `a-interact` portions. ğŸ‘‰ For more details, please visit our [project website](https://bird-interact.github.io/). - [2025-08-26] ğŸ“¬ We'll be sending the **Ground Truth & Test cases** to our mailing list this week. If you want early access, please send an email as instructed on the site for an **automatic download**. - [2025-08-26] ğŸ’¾ On another note, we've also released a SQLite version of **[LiveSQLBench-Lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/livesqlbench-base-lite-sqlite)** for easier local research. The full **LiveSQLBench-Base** and **-Large** versions are coming soon! - [2025-08-22] **Bug Fix**: In Bird-Interact-Agent code, we fixed a bug that when evaluating phase-2 SQL, the stored phase-1 SQL cannot be executed successfully, leading to a lower success rate of Phase-2. This bug only affects those tasks where phase1 sql does some operations on the database, e.g. CREATE table, etc. ## ğŸ§¸ Overview BIRD-INTERACT, an interactive text-to-SQL benchmark, **re-imagines Text-to-SQL evaluation via lens of dynamic interactions**. The environment blends a hierarchical knowledge base, database documentation and a function-driven user simulator to recreate authentic enterprise environments across full **CRUD** operations. It offers two rigorous test modes: (1) passive **Conversational Interaction** and (2) active **Agentic Interaction**, spanning 600 annotated tasks including Business Intelligence (BI), CRUD operations and etc., each guarded by executable test cases. Typical evaluations trigger 1,968-5,496 interaction turns between model and user simulator, while state-of-the-art reasoning models currently solve only **â‰ˆ24%** and **â‰ˆ18%** of tasks, underscoring the benchmark's challenge.

[2025-08-22] **ãƒã‚°ä¿®æ­£**: Bird-Interact-Agentã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã«ã¦ã€phase-2 SQLè©•ä¾¡æ™‚ã«ä¿å­˜ã•ã‚ŒãŸphase-1 SQLãŒæ­£å¸¸ã«å®Ÿè¡Œã•ã‚Œãšã€Phase-2ã®æˆåŠŸç‡ãŒä½ä¸‹ã™ã‚‹ãƒã‚°ã‚’ä¿®æ­£ã—ã¾ã—ãŸã€‚ã“ã®ãƒã‚°ã¯ã€phase1 SQLãŒDBã«å¯¾ã—CREATE tableç­‰ã®æ“ä½œã‚’è¡Œã†ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ã«ã®ã¿å½±éŸ¿ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ ## ğŸ§¸ æ¦‚è¦ BIRD-INTERACTã¯ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ–ãªText-to-SQLãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ã§ã‚ã‚Šã€**å‹•çš„ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã®è¦³ç‚¹ã‹ã‚‰Text-to-SQLè©•ä¾¡ã‚’å†å®šç¾©ã—ã¾ã™**ã€‚ ã“ã®ç’°å¢ƒã¯éšå±¤çš„ãªçŸ¥è­˜ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã€ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒ‰ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆã€é–¢æ•°é§†å‹•å‹ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒŸãƒ¥ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’èåˆã—ã€ä¼æ¥­ç’°å¢ƒã®æœ¬æ ¼çš„ãª**CRUD**æ“ä½œã‚’å†ç¾ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ 2ã¤ã®å³æ ¼ãªãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¢ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ï¼š(1) å—å‹•çš„ãª**ä¼šè©±å‹ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³**ã¨(2) èƒ½å‹•çš„ãª**ã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ³ãƒˆå‹ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³**ã‚’æä¾›ã—ã€Business Intelligence (BI)ã€CRUDæ“ä½œãªã©ã‚’å«ã‚€600ä»¶ã®æ³¨é‡ˆä»˜ãã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ã‚’ç¶²ç¾…ã—ã€ãã‚Œãã‚Œå®Ÿè¡Œå¯èƒ½ãªãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã§ä¿è­·ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ å…¸å‹çš„ãªè©•ä¾¡ã§ã¯ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã¨ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒŸãƒ¥ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¿é–“ã§1,968ï½5,496å›ã®ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ãŒç™ºç”Ÿã—ã€æœ€å…ˆç«¯æ¨è«–ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ã§ã‚‚ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯è§£æ±ºç‡ã¯**ç´„24%**ãŠã‚ˆã³**ç´„18%**ã«ã¨ã©ã¾ã‚Šã€ãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ã®é›£æ˜“åº¦ã‚’ç¤ºã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚

RowTranslations.originContent: - [2025-08-26] ğŸš€ We're excited to announce the release of the **[BIRD-Interact-Full (600)](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-full)** set!
It's a tough one â€” the best LLMs are only achieving a **16.33%** success rate, with just **10.0%** on the `c-interact` and `a-interact` portions.
ğŸ‘‰ For more details, please visit our [project website](https://bird-interact.github.io/).
- [2025-08-26] ğŸ“¬ We'll be sending the **Ground Truth & Test cases** to our mailing list this week.
If you want early access, please send an email as instructed on the site for an **automatic download**.
- [2025-08-26] ğŸ’¾ On another note, we've also released a SQLite version of **[LiveSQLBench-Lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/livesqlbench-base-lite-sqlite)** for easier local research.
The full **LiveSQLBench-Base** and **-Large** versions are coming soon!

- [2025-08-22] **Bug Fix**: In Bird-Interact-Agent code, we fixed a bug that when evaluating phase-2 SQL, the stored phase-1 SQL cannot be executed successfully, leading to a lower success rate of Phase-2. This bug only affects those tasks where phase1 sql does some operations on the database, e.g. CREATE table, etc.
BIRD-INTERACT, an interactive text-to-SQL benchmark, **re-imagines Text-to-SQL evaluation via lens of dynamic interactions**.
The environment blends a hierarchical knowledge base, database documentation and a function-driven user simulator to recreate authentic enterprise environments across full **CRUD** operations.

It offers two rigorous test modes: (1) passive **Conversational Interaction** and (2) active **Agentic Interaction**, spanning 600 annotated tasks including Business Intelligence (BI), CRUD operations and etc., each guarded by executable test cases.

Typical evaluations trigger 1,968-5,496 interaction turns between model and user simulator, while state-of-the-art reasoning models currently solve only **â‰ˆ24%** and **â‰ˆ18%** of tasks, underscoring the benchmark's challenge.

Content: ### âœ… Two Evaluation Modes BIRD-INTERACT supports two evaluation modes as mentioned above: - **c-Interact**: Conversational Interaction which is a passive mode and the workflow is fixed. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_conv`. - **a-Interact**: Agentic Interaction which is an embodied active mode where the workflow is dynamic and led by models. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_agent`. ### ğŸ£ Lite Version We are releasing a lite version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-lite-exp`, which includes 270 high-quality real-world tasks specifically for PostgreSQL. This is a good starting point for quick experimentation. ### ğŸ¦œ Full Version The full version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-full`, is a comprehensive benchmark that includes 600 tasks for PostgreSQL. It covers a wide range of SQL operations and user queries. The full version is coming soon. ### Model Performance Results on BIRD-INTERACT Lite #### 1. **c-Interact** Performance | Rank | Model Name | Normalized Reward | Level | |:------:|--------------------|:-------:|:--------------:| | 1 | o3-mini | 33.04 | ğŸ† Excellent Chat | | 2 | GPT-4o | 30.33 | ğŸ’ Good Chat | | 3 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 27.41 | ğŸ’ Good Chat | | 4 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 26.60 | âœ¨ Standard | | 5 | DeepSeek-R1 | 21.74 | âœ¨ Standard | | 6 | Qwen3 | 20.33 | âšª Basic | | 7 | DeepSeek-V3 | 15.85 | âšª Basic | #### 2. **a-Interact** Performance | Rank | Model Name | Budget Parameters* | Avg Steps/Task | Avg Cost (USD)/Task | Normalized Reward | Level | |:------:|--------------------|:-------------------:|:----------------:|:---------------------:|:-------------------:|:---------------------:| | 1 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 6/6 | 15.4 | $0.6668 | 29.19 | ğŸ† Excellent Interaction | | 2 | o3-mini | 6/6 | 7.8 | $0.0754 | 21.07 | ğŸ’ Good Interaction | | 3 | DeepSeek-V3 | 6/6 | 15.6 | $0.0629 | 19.19 | ğŸ’ Good Interaction | | 4 | Qwen3 | 6/6 | 12.5 | $0.0278 | 18.74 | âœ¨ Standard |

**a-Interact**: ã‚¨ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ³ãƒˆå‹ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã§ã€èƒ½å‹•çš„ã‹ã¤ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«ä¸»å°ã®å‹•çš„ãªãƒ¯ãƒ¼ã‚¯ãƒ•ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã§ã™ã€‚ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚„è©³ç´°ã¯ `bird_interact_agent` ã«ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ ### ğŸ£ ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒˆç‰ˆ BIRD-INTERACTã®ãƒ©ã‚¤ãƒˆç‰ˆ `bird-interact-lite-exp` ã‚’å…¬é–‹ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã¯PostgreSQLç”¨ã«ç‰¹åŒ–ã—ãŸ270ä»¶ã®é«˜å“è³ªãªå®Ÿã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ã‚’å«ã¿ã€è¿…é€Ÿãªå®Ÿé¨“ã®å‡ºç™ºç‚¹ã«é©ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ ### ğŸ¦œ ãƒ•ãƒ«ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ BIRD-INTERACTã®ãƒ•ãƒ«ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ `bird-interact-full` ã¯ã€PostgreSQLç”¨600ä»¶ã®ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ã‚’ç¶²ç¾…ã—ãŸç·åˆãƒ™ãƒ³ãƒãƒãƒ¼ã‚¯ã§ã™ã€‚å¹…åºƒã„SQLæ“ä½œã¨ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒªã‚’ã‚«ãƒãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã™ã€‚ãƒ•ãƒ«ãƒãƒ¼ã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒ³ã¯è¿‘æ—¥å…¬é–‹äºˆå®šã§ã™ã€‚ ### BIRD-INTERACT Liteã«ãŠã‘ã‚‹ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«æ€§èƒ½çµæœ #### 1. **c-Interact** ã®æ€§èƒ½ | ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¯ | ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«å | æ­£è¦åŒ–å ±é…¬ | ãƒ¬ãƒ™ãƒ« | |:------:|--------------------|:-------:|:--------------:| | 1 | o3-mini | 33.04 | ğŸ† å„ªç§€ãªãƒãƒ£ãƒƒãƒˆ | | 2 | GPT-4o | 30.33 | ğŸ’ è‰¯å¥½ãªãƒãƒ£ãƒƒãƒˆ | | 3 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 27.41 | ğŸ’ è‰¯å¥½ãªãƒãƒ£ãƒƒãƒˆ | | 4 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 26.60 | âœ¨ æ¨™æº– | | 5 | DeepSeek-R1 | 21.74 | âœ¨ æ¨™æº– | | 6 | Qwen3 | 20.33 | âšª åŸºæœ¬ | | 7 | DeepSeek-V3 | 15.85 | âšª åŸºæœ¬ | #### 2. **a-Interact** ã®æ€§èƒ½ | ãƒ©ãƒ³ã‚¯ | ãƒ¢ãƒ‡ãƒ«å | äºˆç®—ãƒ‘ãƒ©ãƒ¡ãƒ¼ã‚¿* | å¹³å‡ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—/ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ | å¹³å‡ã‚³ã‚¹ãƒˆ(USD)/ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ | æ­£è¦åŒ–å ±é…¬ | ãƒ¬ãƒ™ãƒ« | |:------:|--------------------|:-------------------:|:----------------:|:---------------------:|:-------------------:|:---------------------:| | 1 | Claude-3.7-sonnet | 6/6 | 15.4 | $0.6668 | 29.19 | ğŸ† å„ªç§€ãªã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ | | 2 | o3-mini | 6/6 | 7.8 | $0.0754 | 21.07 | ğŸ’ è‰¯å¥½ãªã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ | | 3 | DeepSeek-V3 | 6/6 | 15.6 | $0.0629 | 19.19 | ğŸ’ è‰¯å¥½ãªã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¿ãƒ©ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ | | 4 | Qwen3 | 6/6 | 12.5 | $0.0278 | 18.74 | âœ¨ æ¨™æº– |

RowTranslations.originContent: BIRD-INTERACT supports two evaluation modes as mentioned above:
- **c-Interact**: Conversational Interaction which is a passive mode and the workflow is fixed. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_conv`.
- **a-Interact**: Agentic Interaction which is an embodied active mode where the workflow is dynamic and led by models. The code and detailed information can be found in `bird_interact_agent`.

We are releasing a lite version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-lite-exp`, which includes 270 high-quality real-world tasks specifically for PostgreSQL. This is a good starting point for quick experimentation.

The full version of BIRD-INTERACT, `bird-interact-full`, is a comprehensive benchmark that includes 600 tasks for PostgreSQL. It covers a wide range of SQL operations and user queries. The full version is coming soon.
### Model Performance Results on BIRD-INTERACT Lite
| Rank | Model Name         | Normalized Reward | Level        |

| 5 | GPT-4o | 6/6 | 15.3 | $0.4594 | 18.37 | âœ¨ Standard | | 6 | Gemini-2.0-flash | 6/6 | 13.2 | $0.0337 | 17.26 | âšª Basic | | 7 | DeepSeek-R1 | 6/6 | 12.0 | $0.0931 | 17.07 | âšª Basic | > \* Budget Parameters: Starting Budget/User Patience Budget, measured by our virtual currency *bird-coin*s . Refer to [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) for more details. ### Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) refers to a model's ability to continuously increase its end performance through multi-turn interactions. When this interactive performance surpasses the model's idealized single-turn performance on a fully specified, unambiguous task, we say it satisfies the **ITS law**. As user patience grows and interaction turns accumulate, performance keeps improving, demonstrating that the model can sustain effective communication over extended dialogue. Currently, we only find claude-3-7-sonnet satisfies the ITS law.

## ğŸ“¦ Dataset Details ### Dataset Description - **Database:** The complete PostgreSQL database can be download from [the Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Check the [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) section for more details. - **data:** Each data instance contain the following main parts: - `selected_database`: The name of the database. - `query`: The unambiguous user query. - `amb_user_query`: The user query with injected ambiguities. - `user_query_ambiguity`: The ambiguities injected into the user query. - `non_critical_ambiguity`: The non-critical ambiguities like order, limit, etc. - `knowledge_ambiguity`: The ambiguities created by masked external knowledges. - `sol_sql`: The ground truth SQL solution. - `preprocess_sql`: SQL queries to run before executing the solution or prediction. - `clean_up_sql`: SQL queries to run after the test cases to revert any changes made to the database. - `test_cases`: A set of test cases to validate the predicted corrected SQL. - `follow_up`: The labeled follow up questions. - `external_knowledge`: The external knowledge related to the specific task. - **evaluation:** The evaluation code is available in the [`./evaluation`](./evaluation) directory. - **Curated by:** BIRD Team & Google Cloud - **License:** [cc-by-sa-4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) - **HuggingFace Dataset Card:** [bird-interact-lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-lite) ### Dataset Uses

## ğŸ“¦ ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆè©³ç´° ### ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã®èª¬æ˜ - **ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹:** å®Œå…¨ãªPostgreSQLãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã¯[Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view)ã‹ã‚‰ãƒ€ã‚¦ãƒ³ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰å¯èƒ½ã§ã™ã€‚[Quick Eval](#quick-eval) ã‚»ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚‚å‚ç…§ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚ - **data:** å„ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚¹ã¯ä»¥ä¸‹ã®ä¸»è¦éƒ¨åˆ†ã‚’å«ã¿ã¾ã™: - `selected_database`: ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹å - `query`: æ˜ç¢ºãªãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒª - `amb_user_query`: æ›–æ˜§ã•ã‚’æ³¨å…¥ã—ãŸãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒª - `user_query_ambiguity`: ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒªã«æ³¨å…¥ã•ã‚ŒãŸæ›–æ˜§ã• - `non_critical_ambiguity`: é †åºã‚„limitãªã©ã®éé‡è¦ãªæ›–æ˜§ã• - `knowledge_ambiguity`: å¤–éƒ¨çŸ¥è­˜ã‚’ãƒã‚¹ã‚¯ã™ã‚‹ã“ã¨ã§ç”Ÿã˜ã‚‹æ›–æ˜§ã• - `sol_sql`: æ­£è§£SQLã‚½ãƒªãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ - `preprocess_sql`: ã‚½ãƒªãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚„äºˆæ¸¬ã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹å‰ã«å®Ÿè¡Œã™ã‚‹SQLã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒª - `clean_up_sql`: ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¹å¾Œã«ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã®å¤‰æ›´ã‚’å…ƒã«æˆ»ã™ãŸã‚ã®SQLã‚¯ã‚¨ãƒª - `test_cases`: äºˆæ¸¬ã•ã‚ŒãŸä¿®æ­£SQLã‚’æ¤œè¨¼ã™ã‚‹ãŸã‚ã®ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚±ãƒ¼ã‚¹ã®ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆ - `follow_up`: ãƒ©ãƒ™ãƒ«ä»˜ã‘ã•ã‚ŒãŸãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ­ãƒ¼ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—è³ªå• - `external_knowledge`: ç‰¹å®šã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯ã«é–¢é€£ã™ã‚‹å¤–éƒ¨çŸ¥è­˜ - **evaluation:** è©•ä¾¡ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã¯[`./evaluation`](./evaluation) ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã«ã‚ã‚Šã¾ã™ã€‚ - **ä½œæˆ:** BIRD Team & Google Cloud - **ãƒ©ã‚¤ã‚»ãƒ³ã‚¹:** [cc-by-sa-4.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/) - **HuggingFace Dataset Card:** [bird-interact-lite](https://huggingface.co/datasets/birdsql/bird-interact-lite) ### ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚»ãƒƒãƒˆã®ç”¨é€”

RowTranslations.originContent: > \* Budget Parameters: Starting Budget/User Patience Budget, measured by our virtual currency *bird-coin*s . Refer to [bird_interact_agent/README.md](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/bird_interact_agent/README.md#task-setting) for more details.

Interaction-Time Scaling (ITS) refers to a model's ability to continuously increase its end performance through multi-turn interactions. When this interactive performance surpasses the model's idealized single-turn performance on a fully specified, unambiguous task, we say it satisfies the **ITS law**. As user patience grows and interaction turns accumulate, performance keeps improving, demonstrating that the model can sustain effective communication over extended dialogue. Currently, we only find claude-3-7-sonnet satisfies the ITS law.
style="width: 100%; min-width: 100px; display: block; margin: auto; ">
RowTranslations.translatedContent: style="width: 100%; min-width: 100px; display: block; margin: auto; ">

RowTranslations.originContent: - **Database:** The complete PostgreSQL database can be download from [the Google Drive](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KABce6czIqL9kMyIX7i-_A0CIQoDnmyW/view). Check the [Quick Eval](#quick-eval) section for more details.
- **data:** Each data instance contain the following main parts:
- `amb_user_query`: The user query with injected ambiguities.
- `user_query_ambiguity`: The ambiguities injected into the user query.
- `non_critical_ambiguity`: The non-critical ambiguities like order, limit, etc.
- `knowledge_ambiguity`: The ambiguities created by masked external knowledges.
- `preprocess_sql`: SQL queries to run before executing the solution or prediction.
- `clean_up_sql`: SQL queries to run after the test cases to revert any changes made to the database.
- `test_cases`: A set of test cases to validate the predicted corrected SQL.
- `external_knowledge`: The external knowledge related to the specific task.
- **evaluation:** The evaluation code is available in the [`./evaluation`](./evaluation) directory.

Content:
To avoid data leakage by auto-crawling, we do not include GT solution sqls and test cases along with data.
please email [bird.bench25@gmail.com](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bird-bench/BIRD-Interact/main/mailto:bird.bench25@gmail.com) with the tag `[bird-interact-lite GT&Test Cases]` in title for full set, which will be sent automatically.

RowTranslations.originContent: You can download the dataset from HuggingFace using the following command:

Content:
```bash
from datasets import load_dataset
# Load the flash version of the dataset
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-lite")
print(dataset["lite"][0])

# Load the full version of the dataset (coming soon)
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-full")
print(dataset["full"][0])
```
Translation:
```bash
from datasets import load_dataset
# Load the flash version of the dataset
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-lite")
print(dataset["lite"][0])

# Load the full version of the dataset (coming soon)
dataset = load_dataset("birdsql/bird-interact-full")
print(dataset["full"][0])
```

Content: Or you can use the provided script to download the full version of the dataset and split it into different dialects.

```bash
cd baseline/data
python pull_data.py \
  --schema_path path/to/full_schema.jsonl \
  --input_path path/to/input.jsonl \ # Path to the input JSONL file (may be empty if you want to download the dataset from HuggingFace)
  --output_folder path/to/output_dir # output folder of the split files
``` -->
